page.title: 01Mid N Devon Highland.
page.content: The area covers the highesy ridge between Dartmoor and Exmoor, rising to 916' @ Castle Cross, plus a newley built radio telecommunications tower rising some 200' which dominates the landscape. (Uses micro-wave) Grassland farming is the main industry, eight dairy herds, several flocks of sheep and herds of beef cattle graze the grass, a limited acreage of cereals is grown plus an odd acre of potatoes; rainfall is high and drainage often difficult. 90% of the people living in this very sparsely populated area directly involved in farming the land. There is also a post office, garage work shop and a builder in the area. Snipe & Pheasant and wildlife abound, buzzards fly high. Several streams rise in the area will feed the new Roadford Reservoir, and the water
